entry.title: In SAP Build How can I receive the approval email with My Inbox
entry.content: Hi Team~ The process [Sales Order Management (MI01)] created in BPA passed the [Business Accelerator Hub] post test, and My Inbox was empty In SAP Build How can I receive the approval email„ÄÄwith My Inbox B&R Thanks

entry.title: Build Process automation approval form request isn‚Äôt showing up in the Workzone My Inbox
entry.content:
In SAP Build Process Automation (Standard subscription), the approval form requests aren‚Äôt showing up in the Workzone My Inbox for new business users. However, it‚Äôs working fine for the three older business users. I‚Äôve checked, and both new and old users have the same roles assigned, so I‚Äôm not sure what‚Äôs causing the difference.

Do we need to map CIS business users somewhere in the tenant configuration or make any additional setup for new users?

Would really appreciate your insights on this issue to resolve it.

#SAPBuildProcessAutomation
#WorkzoneInbox
#ApprovalFormIssue
#BusinessUserMapping
#TenantConfiguration
#CISUserSetup
#WorkflowTroubleshooting
#SAPSupport
#AutomationIssue
#UserAccessIssue

entry.title: Cannot start any of my Automation anymore
entry.content:
Hi,
I‚Äôve been experiencing a problem with SAP Build Process Automation since last Friday.

  • I did not change anything in my automation.

  • Other users who could previously start the automation also cannot start it anymore.
  • The Start button, which normally displays in German as ‚ÄúWeiter‚Äù, now shows ‚ÄúNext‚Äù when the form loads.
  • As soon as I interact with a text field, dropdown, or any element that triggers onChange, the button becomes enabled, switches to German, and the automation works.
  • This happens in multiple browsers (Edge, Chrome, Incognito) and across different tenants/regions.

Additional info:

  • Network logs show 404 errors for some UI5 Web Components and missing /i18n files. The screenshot shows the errors. 

Has anyone encountered a similar issue? Any advice or workaround would be appreciated.

entry.title: Material Document Goods Receipt Custom Field
entry.content:
Hi Good day 

Any one has done this issue 

so i was basically posting 2 Items Under GR with Custom Field of Date

I'm using script to format the date to epoch from Build Process Automation



This is my Payload


The issue here is whenever the item line of custom field was different it appear on both GR as same data 

for example 

ITEM 1

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 "YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "",
 " YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",

ITEM 2

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 "YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
"YY1_Chilled_Exp_Date_MMI":""

The Material Document Items would be 

ITEM 1 & 2

 "YY1_Ambient_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
"YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",
 " YY1_Frozen_Exp_Date_MMI": "2025-09-02",


 FIELD MAPPING

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation - Rest Call Web Service
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am trying to understand the underlying communication of SAP Desktop Agent. If my Automation has a "REST Call Web Service" Activity, does the Desktop Agent directly calls the URL configured in custom script - Call Web Service Activity | SAP Help Portal, or Desktop Agent communicates with BTP that then communicates with the URL?

I have a setup such that BTP (BPA) is hosted on Azure hyperscaler while my VM resides under GCP (that has Desktop Agent). The URL is also hosted under GCP within same VPC. I want to understand if I need to make changes in network configurations to enable this service call?
SAP Build Process Automation
Thanks, Shruti

entry.title: Is it possible to build an dictionary in SAP BPA ? Where i want call the key to get the value
entry.content: Hi All, I am new to Sap BPA trying to build the invoice extraction process. I want to create an dictionary which is capable to hold key pair values , by using the key I want to get the value , how can i achieve this?

entry.title: How to Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Perfect üëç Here‚Äôs your full rephrased + enhanced message including the part about creating an Action for file upload. You can use this directly in your SAP Community or Blog:

I have created an instance of SAP Document AI and built a few custom schemas to read PDFs. Everything works fine when tested directly in Document AI.

Now, I want to integrate it with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA). For this, I have already created a destination.

My question:
üëâ How can I create an Action in BPA to upload a file to Document AI?

  • Do we need to use a Custom Script to achieve this, or is it recommended to only create Actions in BPA and then call them in a process?

If the recommended approach is to use an Action, can someone guide me on how to create an Action in BPA for file upload?

Specifically:

  • How should the input parameters (like PDF file and options JSON) be defined in the Action?

  • How do we configure the multipart/form-data request inside the Action?

  • Once created, can this Action be directly reused in different BPA processes for uploading files?

Would really appreciate your guidance. Thanks in advance!

For reference, below are the steps I followed in Postman which work successfully:

Step 1: Upload the PDF

Call the Upload API with multipart/form-data.

  • file ‚Üí PDF document

  • options ‚Üí JSON with schema details

Example:

{
  "schemaId": "69d84f47-b658-46fb-a330-d9aadd602112",
  "clientId": "default",
  "documentType": "invoice"
}

üëâ Response returns a Job ID.

Step 2: Check Job Status

Use the Get Job API with the Job ID.
Proceed when status = SUCCEEDED.

Step 3: Fetch Extracted Data

Call the Get Result API with the Job ID to get the extracted data in JSON format (header details, line items, etc.).

‚úÖ Now, I‚Äôm looking for help on how to configure this same upload flow as an Action in SAP BPA, so I can call it directly from an automation.

entry.title: Purchase Order API Posting Error FROM SAP BTP BPA
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I was trying to post a Purchase Order via BPA, and this is the error I received:

 

Spoiler
 "Add new entity to PurchaseOrder 2" failed
Error message: Action '580dfd8f-e028-4e36-8ec3-94b97578cc89' failed with the following error: '400 Bad Request Request Details: { "status code": 400, "url": "S4HANA_DEV_TENANT + /sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_purchaseorder_2/srvd_a2x/sap/purchaseorder/0001/PurchaseOrder","raw response": "{"error":{"code":"SY/530","message":"An exception was raised","target":"","@SAP__common.ExceptionCategory":"Provider_Application_Error","innererror":{"ErrorDetails":{"@SAP__common.Application":{"ComponentId":"MM-PUR-PO","ServiceRepository":"SRVD_A2X","ServiceId":"API_PURCHASEORDER_2","ServiceVersion":"0001"},"@SAP__common.TransactionId":"A43F532D070C00A0E0068BA5847BF9DE","@SAP__common.Timestamp":"20250905093415.00889","@SAP__common.ErrorResolution":{"Analysis":"Use ADT feed reader \"SAP Gateway Error Log\" or run transaction /IWFND/ERROR_LOG on SAP Gateway hub system and search for entries with the timestamp above for more details","Note":"See SAP Note 1797736 for error analysis (https://service.sap.com/sap/support/notes/1797736)"}}}}}" }'.
Log ID: ba5e887e-536f-4982-b6ca-c794246-us10

 


I tried using the payload with the action, and surprisingly, it worked.



I mapped out in Inputs on BPA


 I‚Äôd appreciate any help in resolving this issue. Thanks in advance.

entry.title: How to dynamically assign approvers from CAP table in SAP BPA
entry.content:
I‚Äôm currently building a process in SAP Build Process Automation and I trigger the process from my CAP application. My goal is to pass a table of approvers from CAP into the process via the API Trigger.

In the SAP BPA, I want to loop through this approver table so that each approver gets a task sequentially 

Has anyone implemented something similar before? What‚Äôs the best way to design the process so it can consume the approver table and loop over it properly?

Best Regards, 

Giang Pham

entry.title: Performance difference between SAP BTP Free Account and Paid Account?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I‚Äôm currently working with an SAP BTP Free Account and I‚Äôve noticed some performance limitations when running applications and services (for example, SAP Build Apps, CAP services, and OData calls).

Before moving to a paid account, I‚Äôd like to understand:

  • Are there any performance differences (speed, responsiveness, system resources) between Free and Paid accounts?

  • Do paid accounts get more consistent service levels (e.g., CPU/memory allocation, faster response times, higher quotas)?

  • Is there any official documentation or benchmarks comparing Free vs. Paid accounts?

I‚Äôd really appreciate insights from anyone who has tested both environments or moved from Free to Paid.

Thanks in advance!

entry.title: SAP Document AI - item splitted to 2 pages
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

In SAP Document AI (Premium version), I run into a limitation when invoices or other documents contain line items that are split across two pages.

Instead of treating them as one item, the service always creates two separate items. I know this is a known limitation, but I‚Äôm trying to understand if there are any workarounds or configuration options that can help.

So far I‚Äôve tried:

  • Enabling Instant Learning

  • Setting dataFeedbackCollection = true

‚Ä¶but it doesn‚Äôt improve the results.

  • Has anyone found a reliable way to handle split line items?

  • Are there service settings or template tricks that help?

  • Or is post-processing/merging the only practical solution at this point?

Would love to hear how others are dealing with this.

Thank you

entry.title: Facing issues while using sales order visibility scenario in sap build process automation.
entry.content:
While working on the Sales Order Management (MI03) template in SAP Build Process Automation, I customized the Determine Approver step and set up the approval flow. The process runs smoothly ‚Äî forms are submitted, inbox tasks appear, and confirmation emails are triggered correctly.

To enable visibility, I followed SAP‚Äôs tutorial:
https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-create-process-visibility.html

However, the visibility scenario doesn‚Äôt appear under Monitoring in SAP Build Lobby as expected.

So I deployed it and accessed it via SAP Build Work Zone, following this guide:
https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/spa-configure-workzone.html

The dashboard loads successfully, but all panels ‚Äî including open instances, completed instances, cycle time, and step-level metrics ‚Äî show no data available.


SAP Build Process Automation 
SAP Build 

@KarthikeyanMurthy 
@PierreCol 
@Dan_Wroblewski

entry.title: SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
I want to clarify our scenario regarding SBPA custom forms.

In SBPA, we have two different processes, and each process requires its own custom form. These forms are different in terms of content and footer action buttons.

One of these forms has already been implemented based on an existing UI application and is currently used in SBPA.

My question is: would it be possible to add a second custom form to the same application, given that the outcomes and inputs for this new form will be completely different from the existing one? If so, could you please share an example of how this can be implemented?

Thanks in advance for your guidance.

entry.title: how do I send a request to the SPA workflow from Custom fiori app?
entry.content:
Hi all,
 I'm having an issue with the SAP build process automation.  I created a simple workflow structure and deployed. After, I tested whether  the workflow service on the api.sap site and Postman.   The workflow is working and successfully ƒ± see task in myinbox. 
But when ƒ± try to request from my  custom fiori it gives error.  When I adapt the request in the post, I get a cors error.  So  I thought I definitely needed to send a request through the destination, so I created a destination from the service instance. 
my destination :


After  I described this destinationin xs.app.json file like that

      {
      "source": "^/spalast/(.*)$",
      "target": "/public/workflow/rest/v1/$1",
      "destination": "spa",
      "authenticationType": "none",
      "csrfProtection": false
    },
and lastly my test requests: 

             fetch("/spalast/workflow-instances", {
                method: "POST",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" },
                body: JSON.stringify({
                    definitionId: "eu10.integration-suite-dev-25mloa6z.employeeapitriggerprocess.employeeProcess",
                    context: { employee: { /* ... */ } }
                })
            });
              fetch("/spalast/workflow-instances", {
                method: "GET",
                headers: { "Content-Type": "application/json" }
            });

ƒ±t  gives 403 error  from the POST request and 404 error from the GET request.

What could be the reason for this?  Most of the blogs I read also redirect in this way.

entry.title: Error Importing SAP Ariba Event Management API into SAP Build ‚Äì "API Specification File is Invalid"
entry.content:
Hi SAP Community,

I‚Äôm currently working on creating an Action Project in SAP Build Process Automation using the Event Management API from SAP Ariba, which I accessed via the SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

Here‚Äôs the navigation path I followed:
SAP Business Accelerator Hub > SAP Ariba > SAP Ariba APIs > Event Management API


I received the following error message:

"The API specification file is invalid. As the uploaded file specification format does not align with OpenAPI or CSDL specification standards."

It appears that the specification file provided might not be in OpenAPI (Swagger) or CSDL (OData) format, which is required by SAP Build.

Has anyone successfully integrated the Ariba Event Management API with SAP Build Process Automation?

Any insights, experiences, or recommendations would be greatly appreciated. Thank you in advance!

Best regards,

entry.title: Blog Post : Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation on a Trial Account
entry.content:
Introduction

In today's digital world, automating document-heavy processes is key to improving efficiency and accuracy. Manually extracting data from invoices, purchase orders, or delivery notes is time-consuming and prone to errors. This is where the powerful combination of SAP Document AI and SAP Build Process Automation comes into play.

SAP Document AI uses machine learning to intelligently extract structured data from unstructured documents. SAP Build Process Automation allows you to design, build, and run automated workflows. By integrating these two services, you can create robust automations that read, interpret, and process documents just like a human would, but faster and without fatigue.

In this blog post, we will walk through the steps to integrate these two services on a trial account, using a standard invoice schema to extract data.

Prerequisites

  • An active SAP BTP Trial Account.
  • Access to SAP Build Process Automation in your trial subaccount.
  • Basic familiarity with the SAP Build Process Automation studio.

Step 1: Subscribe to SAP Document AI

The easiest way to get started with SAP Document AI on SAP BTP is by using the booster tool.

  1. Log in to your SAP BTP Trial Account cockpit.
  2. Navigate to your Subaccount and go to the Booster.
  3. Search for "SAP Document AI" and click on Start.
  4. Run the booster. It will automatically:
    1. Subscribe you to the service.
    2. Create a service instance and a service key.
  5. Once the booster completes, go to your Subaccount -> Instances and Subscriptions.
  6. Find your newly created service instance for SAP Document AI and navigate to its Service Keys. Open the default service key.
  7. Crucial: From the JSON of the service key, note down the following values. You will need them in the next step:
    1. uaa.clientid
    2. uaa.clientsecret
    3. uaa.url
Note: To access the SAP Document AI service on the browser (e.g., to check schemas or test manually), ensure your user has the appropriate roles assigned by the booster, such as Document_Information_Extraction_Viewer.

Step 2: Generate an Access Token in your Automation

To call any SAP Document AI API, you need a valid OAuth access token. We will generate this using the client credentials from the service key.

  1. In your SAP Build Process Automation project, create three String variables:
    1. uaaUrl (Value: The uaa.url from your service key)
    2. clientId (Value: The uaa.clientid from your service key)
    3. clientSecret (Value: The uaa.clientsecret from your service key)
  2. Create a fourth variable to hold the combined client ID and secret, encoded in Base64. Name it clientInfo.
  3. Use a Script activity to construct the request for the access token. Set the Output parameter of this script to a variable of type Any (e.g., optionsGet).
    1. Script Code for Access Token Request:
return {
    method: 'GET',
    url: uaaUrl + '/oauth/token?grant_type=client_credentials',
    responseType: 'json', 
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    headers:{
        Authorization:'Basic ' + clientInfo
    }
};
  • After this script, use an Rest Call Web Service activity.
  • The response contains an access_token field. Extract this token into a new string variable or directly pass it to the variable. The value should be:
    1. "Bearer " + step2.obj.access_token

Step 3: Upload a Document for Processing

Now that we have an access token, we can upload an invoice document for processing. We will use the pre-built SAP_invoice_schema.

  1. Ensure you have the path to your invoice file stored in a variable (e.g., fileObj).
  2. Use another Script activity to construct the multipart/form-data request for document upload. The output will be your request configuration.
  3. Use an Rest Call Web Service activity to execute this request.
    1. Script Code for Document Upload:
// Define the extraction options
let optionsPayload = {
    documentType: "custom",
    schemaName: "SAP_invoice_schema", // Using the pre-built schema
    // Below commented values are optional, if you want you can use as per requirement.
    //headerFields: ["deliveryNoteNumber", "purchaseOrderNumber", "deliveryDate"],
    //lineItemFields: ["materialNumber", "quantity", "unitOfMeasure"],
    clientId: "default"
};

// Construct the HTTP request options
let requestOptions = {
    method: "POST",
    url: "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs",
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    metadataType: irpa_core.enums.request.metadataType.formData, // Crucial for file upload
    headers: {
        Authorization: access_Token // Use the variable from previous step
    },
    metadata: [
        {
            name: "file",
            file: fileObj, // Variable holding the file path
        },
        {
            name: "options",
            value: JSON.stringify(optionsPayload)
        }
    ],
    timeout: 30000 // Set a longer timeout for file upload
};

return requestOptions;‚Äã
  • From the uploadResponse, extract two crucial values:
    1. The job id (e.g., into jobId). You will need this to check the result.
    2. The initial status. It will be 'PENDING', meaning the AI is processing the document.

Step 4: Retrieve the Extracted Data

Processing with AI is not instantaneous. We need to poll the service until the status changes from PENDING to DONE.

  1. Create a Data Type: First, create a simple Data Type (e.g., ExtractionResult) with two fields:
    1. Status (Type: String)
    2. Data (Type: Any)
  2. Create a Variable: Create a variable (e.g., finalResult) of this custom type ExtractionResult.
  3. Set Initial Value: Initialize this variable. Set Status to 'PENDING' and leave Data blank.
  4. Build the Polling Request: Create a Script activity to build a GET request to check the job status. The output will be used in an HTTP Request.
    1. Script Code for Retrieving Job Status/Result:
let requestOptions = {
    method: "GET",
    // Use the jobId from the upload step in the URL
    url: "https://aiservices-trial-dox.cfapps.us10.hana.ondemand.com/document-information-extraction/v1/document/jobs/" + jobId,
    responseType: "json",
    resolveBodyOnly: true,
    headers: {
        Authorization: access_Token, // Re-use the same access token
        'Cache-Control': 'no-cache'
    }
};
return requestOptions;‚Äã
  • Implement the Polling Loop:
    1. Drag a Forever Loop into your workflow.
    2. In the loop's Condition, use the expression: finalResult.Status !== 'PENDING'. This means the loop will break as soon as the status is no longer 'PENDING'.
    3. Inside the loop:
      1. Use a Wait activity (e.g., wait for 2 seconds) to avoid making too many API calls.
      2. Use the Rest Call Web Service activity with the configuration from the script above. Store the output in a temporary variable (e.g., pollResponse).
      3. Use a Set Variable activity to update finalResult.Status with pollResponse.status  with pollResponse.
    4. The loop will continue until the status in the API response changes to 'DONE'. Once it breaks out of the loop, finalResult.Data will contain the fully extracted invoice data!

You can now use the extracted data in the subsequent steps of your automation, such as filling a form or triggering another process.

The Flow will look like this:

Conclusion

Congratulations! You have successfully integrated SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation. You have built an automation that can submit documents for processing and patiently wait for the AI to return the extracted structured data. This pattern can be applied to countless use cases involving invoices, contracts, forms, and more, unlocking significant potential for automation within your business processes.

This is just the beginning. You can explore creating custom schemas tailored to your specific document types for even more precise extraction.

Feel free to connect here or on LinkedIn for any questions or suggestions.

LinkedIn : Indrajit Shah https://www.linkedin.com/in/indrajit-shahkumar/
LinkedIn : Aditi Jain https://www.linkedin.com/in/aditi-jain-3b6b4a190/
Co-Author @Aditi1912
